spanishExample: ¡Hay algo sobre tu casa!
englishTranslation: There’s something above your house!
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: ¿Adónde iba hace dos años?
englishTranslation: Where was he going two years ago?
vocabIncluded: iba: "was going", "he/she/it was going" (Ir, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Él sabía que esto no era suyo.
englishTranslation: He knew this wasn’t his.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Han estado aquí sin él desde esta mañana.
englishTranslation: They have been here without him since this morning.
vocabIncluded: han: "have", "they have" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Estoy yendo hacia la casa ahora.
englishTranslation: I’m going towards the house now.

spanishExample: He estado *walking* desde *the center* de *the city.*
englishTranslation: I’ve been walking since the city center.
vocabIncluded: he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: He sabido que hay algo entre ellos.
englishTranslation: I have known there is something between them.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Iban hacia ese lugar durante *the war.*
englishTranslation: They were going toward that place during the war.
vocabIncluded: iban: "were going", "they were going" (Ir, imperfect, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Lo sabrás durante la fiesta.
englishTranslation: You will know it during the party.
vocabIncluded: sabrás: "will know", "you will know" (Saber, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No sabían que esto no era tuyo.
englishTranslation: They didn’t know this wasn’t yours.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: No sabría adónde ir.
englishTranslation: I wouldn’t know where to go.
vocabIncluded: sabría: "would know", "I would know" (Saber, conditional, 1st person)

spanishExample: No sabría la verdad.
englishTranslation: He wouldn’t know the truth.
vocabIncluded: sabría: "would know", "he/she/it would know" (Saber, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que él sepa que esto es tuyo.
englishTranslation: I want him to know that this is yours.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Quiero que sepas que esto no es suyo.
englishTranslation: I want you to know that this isn’t his.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Quiero *to walk* desde *France* hasta *Spain.*
englishTranslation: I want to walk from France to Spain.

spanishExample: Sabe que hemos estado aquí desde ese día.
englishTranslation: He knows we have been here since that day.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hemos: "have", "we have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Sabía que no era bueno, pero no quiero que lo sepan.
englishTranslation: I knew it wasn’t good, but I don’t want them to know.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)

spanishExample: Sabré si es mío.
englishTranslation: I will know if it is mine.
vocabIncluded: sabré: "will know", "I will know" (Saber, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Sabremos más sobre el lugar donde estábamos sin ti hace tres semanas.
englishTranslation: We’ll know more about the place where we were without you three weeks ago.
vocabIncluded: sabremos: "will know", "we will know" (Saber, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Si él supiera eso, tú también lo sabrías.
englishTranslation: If he knew that, you would know it too.
vocabIncluded: sabrías: "would know", "you would know" (Saber, conditional, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Si hubiera más personas contra la *company,* sería mía.
englishTranslation: If there were more people against the company(f), it would be mine.
vocabIncluded: hubiera: "there were to be" (Haber, past subjunctive, impersonal)
sería: "would be", "he/she/it would be" (Ser, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si no se lo *you tell,* no sabrá que hubo *an accident.*
englishTranslation: If you don’t tell him, he won’t know there was an accident.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
"se" to mean "le" or "les", as in "se lo" or "se la"
sabrá: "will know", "he/she/it will know" (Saber, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si supiera que hay algo bajo *the bed,* no *I would sleep.*
englishTranslation: If I knew there is something under the bed, I wouldn’t sleep.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)

spanishExample: Si supieran que eso está sobre *the table,* no *they would eat.*
englishTranslation: If they knew that that is on the table, they wouldn’t eat.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
supieran: "knew", "they knew" (Saber, past subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Supo que había un problema entre ellos.
englishTranslation: He found out there was a problem between them.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
había: "there was/were" indicating existence (Haber, imperfect, impersonal)
supe: "knew / found out", "he/she/it knew / found out" (Saber, preterite, 3rd person)
